content:
The #MeToo movement has had a significant impact on workplaces in terms of policies and procedures related to sexual harassment and assault. Many employers have taken steps to review and revise their policies and procedures to address the issues raised by #MeToo.

Some of the ways that the #MeToo movement has inspired changes in policy and practice include:

1. Review of existing policies: Many employers have reviewed their existing policies regarding sexual harassment and assault to ensure that they are up-to-date and reflect best practices. This includes ensuring that staff members receive appropriate training and education on the topic of harassment and assault.

2. Changes in complaint procedures: Many employers have changed their complaint procedures to make them more to be victim-centered and to provide a safer and more supportive environment for survivors reporting harassment or assault.

3. Accountability and consequences: There is now greater accountability for individuals accused of sexual harassment or assault. Many organizations have introduced more severe penalties for those found guilty of such behaviour, including immediate suspension or termination from their employment.

4. Creating safe spaces: There have been changes in the design of workplaces to encourage a more safe and supportive environment, including creating safe spaces where employees can receive confidential support.

These changes in policies and procedures are important steps to creating safer and supportive environments for employees to work in. The #MeToo movement highlights the need for continued efforts to prevent sexual harassment and assault within the workplace, and these changes are fundamental to achieving this.
